name: Dragonfly
descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) is a cyber espionage group that has been attributed to Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) Center 16.(Citation: DOJ Russia Targeting Critical Infrastructure March 2022)(Citation: UK GOV FSB Factsheet April 2022) Active since at least 2010, [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has targeted defense and aviation companies, government entities, companies related to industrial control systems, and critical infrastructure sectors worldwide through supply chain, spearphishing, and drive-by compromise attacks.(Citation: Symantec Dragonfly)(Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)(Citation: Symantec Dragonfly Sept 2017)(Citation: Fortune Dragonfly 2.0 Sept 2017)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)(Citation: CISA AA20-296A Berserk Bear December 2020)(Citation: Symantec Dragonfly 2.0 October 2017)

subtechniques.name: Domain Account
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used batch scripts to enumerate users on a victim domain controller.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Additional Local or Domain Groups
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has added newly created accounts to the administrators group to maintain elevated access.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Domains
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has registered domains for targeting intended victims.(Citation: CISA AA20-296A Berserk Bear December 2020)

subtechniques.name: Virtual Private Server
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has acquired VPS infrastructure for use in malicious campaigns.(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

subtechniques.name: Vulnerability Scanning
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has scanned targeted systems for vulnerable Citrix and Microsoft Exchange services.(Citation: CISA AA20-296A Berserk Bear December 2020)

subtechniques.name: File Transfer Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used SMB for C2.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Archive Collected Data
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has compressed data into .zip files prior to exfiltration.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has added the registry value ntdll to the Registry Run key to establish persistence.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Brute Force

subtechniques.name: Password Cracking
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has dropped and executed tools used for password cracking, including Hydra and [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488).(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Kali Hydra)

technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has attempted to brute force credentials to gain access.(Citation: CISA AA20-296A Berserk Bear December 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used the command line for execution.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used PowerShell scripts for execution.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Symantec Dragonfly Sept 2017)

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used various types of scripting to perform operations, including batch scripts.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Python
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used various types of scripting to perform operations, including Python scripts. The group was observed installing Python 2.7 on a victim.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Server
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has compromised legitimate websites to host C2 and malware modules.(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

subtechniques.name: Local Account
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has created accounts on victims, including administrator accounts, some of which appeared to be tailored to each individual staging target.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Local System
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has collected data from local victim systems.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Local Data Staging
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has created a directory named "out" in the user's %AppData% folder and copied files to it.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Drive-by Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has compromised targets via strategic web compromise (SWC) utilizing a custom exploit kit.(Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Drive-by Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) utilized watering hole attacks on energy sector websites by injecting a redirect iframe to deliver [Backdoor.Oldrea](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0093) or [Trojan.Karagany](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0094). (Citation: Symantec Security Response July 2014)

subtechniques.name: Remote Email Collection
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has accessed email accounts using Outlook Web Access.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has conducted SQL injection attacks, exploited vulnerabilities CVE-2019-19781 and CVE-2020-0688 for Citrix and MS Exchange, and CVE-2018-13379 for Fortinet VPNs.(Citation: CISA AA20-296A Berserk Bear December 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has exploited CVE-2011-0611 in Adobe Flash Player to gain execution on a targeted system.(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has exploited a Windows Netlogon vulnerability (CVE-2020-1472) to obtain access to Windows Active Directory servers.(Citation: CISA AA20-296A Berserk Bear December 2020)

technique_table_data.name: External Remote Services
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used VPNs and Outlook Web Access (OWA) to maintain access to victim networks.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: CISA AA20-296A Berserk Bear December 2020)

technique_table_data.name: File and Directory Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used a batch script to gather folder and file names from victim hosts.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)(Citation: CISA AA20-296A Berserk Bear December 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Forced Authentication
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has gathered hashed user credentials over SMB using spearphishing attachments with external resource links and by modifying .LNK file icon resources to collect credentials from virtualized systems.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

subtechniques.name: Business Relationships
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has collected open source information to identify relationships between organizations for targeting purposes.(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

subtechniques.name: Hidden Users
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has modified the Registry to hide created user accounts.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify System Firewall
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has disabled host-based firewalls. The group has also globally opened port 3389.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Clear Windows Event Logs
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has cleared Windows event logs and other logs produced by tools they used, including system, security, terminal services, remote services, and audit logs. The actors also deleted specific Registry keys.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: File Deletion
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has deleted many of its files used during operations as part of cleanup, including removing applications and deleting screenshots.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has copied and installed tools for operations once in the victim environment.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Masquerade Account Name
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has created accounts disguised as legitimate backup and service accounts as well as an email administration account.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Modify Registry
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has modified the Registry to perform multiple techniques through the use of [Reg](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0075).(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Network Share Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has identified and browsed file servers in the victim network, sometimes , viewing files pertaining to ICS or Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has obtained and used tools such as [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002), [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488), and [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029).(Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)

subtechniques.name: Security Account Manager
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has dropped and executed SecretsDump to dump password hashes.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: NTDS
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has dropped and executed SecretsDump to dump password hashes. They also obtained ntds.dit from domain controllers.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Core Security Impacket)

subtechniques.name: LSA Secrets
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has dropped and executed SecretsDump to dump password hashes.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Core Security Impacket)

subtechniques.name: Domain Groups
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used batch scripts to enumerate administrators and users in the domain.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has sent emails with malicious attachments to gain initial access.(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used spearphishing with Microsoft Office attachments to enable harvesting of user credentials.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used spearphishing with PDF attachments containing malicious links that redirected to credential harvesting websites.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Query Registry
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has queried the Registry to identify victim information.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has moved laterally via RDP.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has likely obtained a list of hosts in the victim environment.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used scheduled tasks to automatically log out of created accounts every 8 hours as well as to execute malicious files.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Screen Capture
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has performed screen captures of victims, including by using a tool, scr.exe (which matched the hash of ScreenUtil).(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Symantec Dragonfly Sept 2017)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

subtechniques.name: Web Shell
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has commonly created Web shells on victims' publicly accessible email and web servers, which they used to maintain access to a victim network and download additional malicious files.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Drive-by Target
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has compromised websites to redirect traffic and to host exploit kits.(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

subtechniques.name: Compromise Software Supply Chain
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has placed trojanized installers for control system software on legitimate vendor app stores.(Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Supply Chain Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) trojanized legitimate ICS equipment providers software packages available for download on their websites.(Citation: Symantec Security Response July 2014)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used batch scripts to enumerate network information, including information about trusts, zones, and the domain.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: System Owner/User Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) used the command query user on victim hosts.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

technique_table_data.name: Template Injection
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has injected SMB URLs into malicious Word spearphishing attachments to initiate [Forced Authentication](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1187).(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has used various forms of spearphishing in attempts to get users to open malicious attachments.(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Valid Accounts
technique_table_data.descr: [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035) has compromised user credentials and used valid accounts for operations.(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)(Citation: CISA AA20-296A Berserk Bear December 2020)

software_data.name: Backdoor.Oldrea
software_data.descr: (Citation: Symantec Dragonfly)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

software_data.name: CrackMapExec
software_data.descr: (Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

software_data.name: PsExec
software_data.descr: (Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)(Citation: US-CERT TA18-074A)(Citation: Symantec Dragonfly Sept 2017)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

software_data.name: Trojan.Karagany
software_data.descr: (Citation: Symantec Dragonfly)(Citation: Secureworks Karagany July 2019)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

alias_descriptions.name: TEMP.Isotope
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Mandiant Ukraine Cyber Threats January 2022)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)

alias_descriptions.name: DYMALLOY
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Dragos DYMALLOY )(Citation: UK GOV FSB Factsheet April 2022)

alias_descriptions.name: Berserk Bear
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)(Citation: DOJ Russia Targeting Critical Infrastructure March 2022)(Citation: UK GOV FSB Factsheet April 2022)

alias_descriptions.name: TG-4192
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)(Citation: UK GOV FSB Factsheet April 2022)

alias_descriptions.name: Crouching Yeti
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)(Citation: DOJ Russia Targeting Critical Infrastructure March 2022)(Citation: UK GOV FSB Factsheet April 2022)

alias_descriptions.name: IRON LIBERTY
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)(Citation: Secureworks Karagany July 2019)(Citation: UK GOV FSB Factsheet April 2022)

alias_descriptions.name: Energetic Bear
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Symantec Dragonfly)(Citation: Secureworks IRON LIBERTY July 2019)(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)(Citation: Secureworks Karagany July 2019)(Citation: Gigamon Berserk Bear October 2021)(Citation: DOJ Russia Targeting Critical Infrastructure March 2022)(Citation: UK GOV FSB Factsheet April 2022)
